description: Simple and easy to use, just missing help information / how to use it. I was just confused at the start on how to drag the things. Using 0.3.3
Works great, but placement could be better, and an option to collapse Left and Right into a "Stereo" ...

I use this to pipe the audio output from plex into the microphone input for discord to allow streaming of my music i have composed to my group. One improvement would be being able to save profiles and also move the blocks (for each input/output around as sometimes they appear in strange places! But otherwise works brilliantly with Pipewire

This application is awesome! Now I do not need to layer on qjackctl on my Fedora Silverblue/Kinoite system to manage my audio connections. Helvum can do it now, and I can reduce the amount of layers. 

After using it for a bit, it acts just the same as qjackctl Graph. Even shows dynamic sources like when I open KDE's audio panel.

I have a specific need: to permanently link two outputs (HDMI and USB audio interface), so that all audio is output on both, and that setup persists permanently.

Helvium can't do that, and QJackCtl could, befire pipewire. In QjackCtl you can link sinks by Ctrl-clicking both, then choosing "Connect". There is no parallel functionality in Helvium: you have to drag between each separate channel of a 7.1 and stereo sink. Then on next boot, you have to do it all over again.

Maybe you can do all this in Helvsium, but there is no help for this app.
It took a minute, then I got how it works. This is nice.
summary: Once you get the hang of it, it works well

description: helped me to play 2 sound outputs at the same time

can't unlink audio channels, and if you can it is impossible to know how. completely useless until then, why even bother developin this if you can't even bother to allow users to undo their actions. that's ux 101
Although it might be a bit too simple for some, it provides the features I personally need. It is also very intuitive, so there is no need to do complicated stuff.
summary: Very easy to use with the needed features

description: This is exactly what I would write myself if I wanted to get simple but functional GUI for pipewire audio output control. 10/10
summary: One of the best GUI apps on linux

description: sometimes it forgets your selection and you have to redrag it. also should add a save configuration option per application or module. otherwise works as intended to reroute your audio video and other data. my use case is using steam deck speakers in conjunction with my external monitor speakers.
Good app. If you don't know how to unlink, you just have to create a link twice.
Allows me to route audio from a digital amp and a webcam microphone into the browser so I can combine audio inputs.
This is useful for a lot of things like livestreaming, watching movies with two pairs of headphones or just trolling friends on Discord

ou pour avoir le même flux audio sur plusieurs sorties.
L'ergonomie est originale mais pourrait être améliorée.
summary: Très pratique pour choisir une sortie différente pour chaque appli

description: très pratique pour connecter plusieurs casques en bluetooth et en jack et diffuser le même flux sur tous.
summary: pratique pour écouter une vidéo à plusieurs

description: The wiring part is fun and direct.
